question.body: Warfarin is an anticoagulant that may be prescribed by a doctor. What is the function of this drug?

multiple_choice.choice: Increases clotting by blocking vitamin K.
Reduces clotting by reducing vitamin K function.
Increases clotting by activating vitamin K.
Reduces clotting by blocking calcium function.

response.feedback: Incorrect. An anticoagulant is going to prevent clotting not increase clotting.
Correct. Warfarin can reduce clotting by acting as an antagonist to vitamin K.
Incorrect. Warfarin is an anticoagulant which means it decreases clotting. Increasing vitamin K activity would increase clotting ability.
Incorrect. Warfarin is an antagonist to vitamin K not calcium.
